item.title: This is an example post
item.description:
Here is the description of the example blog post. You’d want to summarize the contents of the following post. Don’t let this get too long, though!

Here your blog post starts.

Text

You can use markdown formatting.

  • Bold text.
  • Italic text.
  • More italic text.
  • Strikethrough text.

Links

Markdown lets us include links in three formats. Inline-style links can often get very long and make reading the markdown source harder. Reference-style links are shorter and thus preferred.

Images

For images, we could use markdown image tags too. However, it’s recommended to use the custom center-figure Hugo shortcode. This is based on the built-in figure shortcode but automatically centers the image and captions.

{{< center-figure src="/logo-512.png" caption="The bitcoin-dev.blog logo." height=128 width=128 >}}

produces

Generally, including images in the repository is preferred to linking to external images. Check if you have permission to include the image.

Code

The built-in shortcode highlight can be used to showcase code.

{{< highlight rust >}}
let mut builder = wallet_bob.build_tx();
builder
.add_recipient(addr.script_pubkey(), 60_000)
.add_foreign_utxo(alice_outpoint, alice_psbt_input, satisfaction_weight)?;
{{< /highlight >}}

produces

 let mut builder = wallet_bob.build_tx();
builder
.add_recipient(addr.script_pubkey(), 60_000)
.add_foreign_utxo(alice_outpoint, alice_psbt_input, satisfaction_weight)?;

Footnotes

We can include footnotes1 by using [^ref] where ref is reference to a [^ref]: <footnote-text>.

Tweets

Hugo offers a built-in tweet shortcode too.

{{< tweet 1110302988 >}}

Running bitcoin

— halfin (@halfin) January 11, 2009

Videos

Vimeo and YouTube videos can be embedded with the vimeo and youtube tags.

{{< vimeo 412058509 >}} produces

{{< youtube Ey0xAcN11zk >}} produces
